title: 5k-Mile 2002 Dodge Viper GTS Final Edition at No Reserve
description: This 2002 Dodge Viper is #224 of 360 Final Edition GTS Coupes produced for the model year, and its previous owner acquired it in 2004 from Carson Dodge Chrysler of Carson City, Nevada, with just over 800 miles shown. The car remained registered in the state until it was purchased and relocated to Arizona by the seller in December 2023, and it now shows 5k miles. Finished in Viper Red with dual Stone White stripes over black leather, the car is powered by an 8.0-liter V10 paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Modifications include a Corsa exhaust system, "smooth" air-intake tubes, and Baer Eradispeed two-piece drilled and slotted brake rotors. Additional equipment includes a limited-slip differential, 18″ polished aluminum-alloy wheels, projector-style headlights, air conditioning, and an Alpine CD stereo. This Viper GTS is now offered at no reserve with 2004 sales documents, service records, two sets of keys and remotes, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a No Reserve: 5k-Mile 2002 Dodge Viper GTS Final Edition at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #187,342.
text: This 2002 Dodge Viper is #224 of 360 Final Edition GTS Coupes produced for the model year, and its previous owner acquired it in 2004 from Carson Dodge Chrysler of Carson City, Nevada, with just over 800 miles shown. The car remained registered in the state until it was purchased and relocated to Arizona by the seller in December 2023, and it now shows 5k miles. Finished in Viper Red with dual Stone White stripes over black leather, the car is powered by an 8.0-liter V10 paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Modifications include a Corsa exhaust system, “smooth” air-intake tubes, and Baer Eradispeed two-piece drilled and slotted brake rotors. Additional equipment includes a limited-slip differential, 18″ polished aluminum-alloy wheels, projector-style headlights, air conditioning, and an Alpine CD stereo. This Viper GTS is now offered at no reserve with 2004 sales documents, service records, two sets of keys and remotes, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title in the seller’s name. All Final Edition Viper GTS Coupes were built at the Conner Avenue Assembly Plant in Detroit and finished in Viper Red Clear Coat with painted Stone White Le Mans-style stripes. Equipment includes projector-style headlights, fog lights, a vented hood, and dual center-exit exhaust outlets. The seller notes that a front nose protector and a California Car Cover Co. cover will accompany the car. The 18″ polished aluminum-alloy wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact Sport 02 tires, which show date codes from 2022. Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs, which have been fitted with Baer Eradispeed two-piece drilled and slotted rotors. ABS was introduced on the Viper for the 2001 model year. The cabin features bucket seats upholstered in black leather along with a color-matching dashboard, center console, door panels, and shift knob. Additional equipment includes an Alpine CD stereo, air conditioning, adjustable pedals, power windows, and dual airbags. A plaque affixed to the gear selector surround indicates chassis #224 of 360 Final Edition examples built. The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline. Auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, fuel level, and voltage are mounted atop the center stack. The six-digit odometer shows 5k miles. The 8.0-liter OHV V10 was factory rated at 450 horsepower and 490 lb-ft of torque. “Smooth” air-intake tubes and a Corsa exhaust system have been added. The battery was replaced in February 2025. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Tremec T-56 six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage. html:
This 2002 Dodge Viper is #224 of 360 Final Edition GTS Coupes produced for the model year, and its previous owner acquired it in 2004 from Carson Dodge Chrysler of Carson City, Nevada, with just over 800 miles shown. The car remained registered in the state until it was purchased and relocated to Arizona by the seller in December 2023, and it now shows 5k miles. Finished in Viper Red with dual Stone White stripes over black leather, the car is powered by an 8.0-liter V10 paired with a six-speed manual transmission. Modifications include a Corsa exhaust system, “smooth” air-intake tubes, and Baer Eradispeed two-piece drilled and slotted brake rotors. Additional equipment includes a limited-slip differential, 18″ polished aluminum-alloy wheels, projector-style headlights, air conditioning, and an Alpine CD stereo. This Viper GTS is now offered at no reserve with 2004 sales documents, service records, two sets of keys and remotes, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Arizona title in the seller’s name.

All Final Edition Viper GTS Coupes were built at the Conner Avenue Assembly Plant in Detroit and finished in Viper Red Clear Coat with painted Stone White Le Mans-style stripes. Equipment includes projector-style headlights, fog lights, a vented hood, and dual center-exit exhaust outlets. The seller notes that a front nose protector and a California Car Cover Co. cover will accompany the car.

The 18″ polished aluminum-alloy wheels are mounted with Continental ExtremeContact Sport 02 tires, which show date codes from 2022. Braking is handled by four-wheel ventilated discs, which have been fitted with Baer Eradispeed two-piece drilled and slotted rotors. ABS was introduced on the Viper for the 2001 model year.

The cabin features bucket seats upholstered in black leather along with a color-matching dashboard, center console, door panels, and shift knob. Additional equipment includes an Alpine CD stereo, air conditioning, adjustable pedals, power windows, and dual airbags.

A plaque affixed to the gear selector surround indicates chassis #224 of 360 Final Edition examples built.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 200-mph speedometer and a tachometer with a 6k-rpm redline. Auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature, oil pressure, fuel level, and voltage are mounted atop the center stack. The six-digit odometer shows 5k miles.

The 8.0-liter OHV V10 was factory rated at 450 horsepower and 490 lb-ft of torque. “Smooth” air-intake tubes and a Corsa exhaust system have been added. The battery was replaced in February 2025.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a Tremec T-56 six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential.

The Carfax report is free from accidents or other reported damage.
